writingApproach.style: Conversational; use analogies and real-world examples
writingApproach.complexity: Simple sentences; define all jargon; avoid acronyms or explain them immediately
writingApproach.structure: Start with 'why it matters'; build concepts step-by-step
writingApproach.wordChoice: Everyday language; assume no prior knowledge

do: Use everyday analogies: 'A flow wrapper works like gift-wrapping a present, but at high speed...'
Show practical examples: 'For example, the granola bars you see at the store...'
Connect concepts to familiar products they use daily
dont: Assume knowledge of packaging industry terms
Use unexplained acronyms (VFFS, HFFS, OPP, etc.)
Present too many machine types at once without clear categorization

userContext.situation: The searcher is exploring packaging automation, possibly for a business decision or general learning. They want to understand the mechanics behind automatic filling machines before making further decisions about equipment.
userContext.currentState: They know automatic filling machines exist but don't understand HOW they actually work. They may be confused about the different components, filling mechanisms, or how the automation is achieved.
userContext.desiredState: After reading, they want a clear mental picture of how an automatic filling machine operates - from product entry to filled container exit. They want to understand core components and basic working principles.

searchIntent.coreQuestion: What are the key components of an automatic filling machine and how do they work together to fill containers automatically?
implicitQuestions: What are the main parts/components of an automatic filling machine?
What are the different types of filling mechanisms (volumetric, gravimetric, piston, etc.)?

searchIntent.successCriteria: Reader can explain to someone else the basic working principle of an automatic filling machine, name at least 3-4 key components, and understand why different filling mechanisms exist for different products.

goldenInsights.insight: Automatic filling machines can fill 40-120 bottles per minute with +/-0.5% accuracy - compared to 10-20 bottles per hour with manual labor
Accuracy and speed do not come together. Auger filling is precise but slow. Volumetric filling is fast but rough.
ROI of 214% with 18-month payback from automation
Most common problem is simply the machine not sitting level on the production floor
